column2: When CRG replacement is detected Toner CRG replacement completion alarm - SubCode: 0071: Genuine product - SubCode: 0181: Non-genuin Product
When the Toner CRG is detected empty
Temperature of the Main Thermistor did not become the specified temperature although the specified time had passed.
1. Check the connector between the Fixing Assembly and the Fixing Power Supply Unit. 2. Replace the Fixing Assembly. 3. Replace the Fixing Power Supply Unit.
The Main Thermistor detected a temperature higher than the specified temperature.
1. Check the connector between the Fixing Assembly and the Fixing Power Supply Unit. 2. Replace the Fixing Assembly. 3. Replace the Fixing Power Supply Unit.
Error in either the Fixing Heater or the Main Motor

1. Check the connector between the Fixing Assembly and the Fixing Power Supply Unit. 2. Check the connection of the Main Motor. 3. Replace the Fixing Assembly. 4. Replace the Main Motor. 5. Replace the Fixing Power Supply Unit.
1. Check the connector between the DC Controller PCB and the Fixing Power Supply PCB. 2. Replace the Fixing Power Supply PCB. 3. Replace the DC Controller PCB.
Error in startup of the Main Motor
1. Check the connection of the Main Motor. 2. Replace the Main Motor. 3. Replace the DC Controller PCB.
Error in rotation of the Main Motor
1. Check the connection of the Main Motor. 2. Replace the Main Motor. 3. Replace the DC Controller PCB.

1. Check the Cassette 1 Lifter Motor (dropout, gear tooth jump, etc.). 2. Check the connector between the Cassette 1 Lifter Motor and the DC Controller PCB. 3. Replace the Main Drive Unit (the Cassette 1 Lifter Motor included) 4. Replace the DC Controller PCB.

1. Check the Cassette 2 Lifter Motor (dropout, gear tooth jump, etc.). 2. Check the connector between the Cassette 2 Lifter Motor and the Cassette 2 Driver PCB. 3. Replace the Drive Unit (the Cassette 2 Lifter Motor included) 4. Replace the Cassette 2 Driver PCB.

1. Check the Cassette 3 Lifter Motor (dropout, gear tooth jump, etc.). 2. Check the connector between the Cassette 3 Lifter Motor and the Cassette 3 Driver PCB. 3. Replace the Drive Unit (the Cassette 3 Lifter Motor included) 4. Replace the Cassette 3 Driver PCB.

1. Check the Cassette 4 Lifter Motor (dropout, gear tooth jump, etc.). 2. Check the connector between the Cassette 4 Lifter Motor and the Cassette 4 Driver PCB. 3. Replace the Drive Unit (the Cassette 4 Lifter Motor included) 4. Replace the Cassette 4 Driver PCB.
Failure of the Environment Sensor was detected.
1. Replace the High Voltage Power Supply PCB (the Environment Sensor included) 2. Replace the DC Controller PCB.
Failure of the EEPROM was detected.
1. Turn OFF and then ON the power. 2. Replace the Main Controller PCB.
Failure of the Laser Assembly in the Laser Scanner Unit
1. Check the connector of the Laser Scanner Unit. 2. Replace the Laser Scanner Unit. 3. Replace the DC Controller PCB.
Error in the initial operation of the Scanner Motor
1. Check the connector of the Laser Scanner Unit. 2. Replace the Laser Scanner Unit. 3. Replace the DC Controller PCB.
Error in rotation of the Scanner Motor
1. Check the connector between the Laser Scanner Unit and the DC Controller PCB. 2. Replace the Laser Scanner Unit. 3. Replace the DC Controller PCB.
Firmware error (The host machine or the option cassette)
1. Turn OFF and then ON the power. 2. Update firmware. 3. Replace the DC Controller PCB
The memory area in the DC Controller cannot be accessed.
1. Turn OFF and then ON the power. 2. Update firmware. 3. Replace the DC Controller PCB
Host machine FRAM write error was detected.
Host machine FRAM write error was detected.
Capacity of the installed SD Card is smaller than the size of the area used for the system.
1. Check the capacity of the SD Card. 2. Replace the SD Card with another one with 2 GB or more capacity.
Loading of Bootable ends in failure.
1. Reinstall the firmware. 2. Replace the Main Controller PCB.
Error caused by hardware (such as damage on the sector, etc.) occurred when accessing to the SD Card during execution of Boot ROM
1. Turn OFF and then ON the power. 2. Back up data, and format the SD Card. 3. Replace the SD Card. 4. Replace the Main Controller PCB.
Loading of Subbootable ends in failure.
1. Reinstall the firmware. 2. Replace the Main Controller PCB.
1. Reinstall the firmware. 2. Replace the Main Controller PCB.
The memory area in the Main Controller is depleted
Remaining memory area in the Main Controller is small.

* Turning OFF and then ON the main power stops the error code to be displayed, but the continuous use causes the memory area in the Main Controller PCB to be completely used up or causes symptoms such as machine freeze. 1. Replace the Main Controller PCB.
MEAP cannot be started due to an error caused by invalid power down.

1. Select Function.gr > MEAP > MEAP FUNCTION = ON, and turn OFF and then ON the main power. * Since the installed MEAP application and its management information are all cleared after reboot, MEAP needs to be reinstalled.
File system could not be initialized normally. (MEAP-related)
File system could not be initialized normally.

1. Turning OFF and then ON the main power executes auto recovery. Since E616-0001 may be displayed in some cases, execute the remedy for E616-0001. * When this error occurs, the firmware downloaded by the CDS Updater will be lost.

1. Turning OFF and then ON the main power executes auto recovery. Since E616-0001 may be displayed in some cases, execute the remedy for E616-0001. * When this error occurs, the firmware downloaded by the CDS Updater will be lost.

1. Turning OFF and then ON the main power executes auto recovery. Since E616-0001 may be displayed in some cases, execute the remedy for E616-0001. * When this error occurs, the firmware downloaded by the CDS Updater will be lost.
File system could not be initialized normally.
File system could not be initialized normally.
1. Turning OFF and then ON the main power executes auto recovery. * When this error occurs, the firmware downloaded by the CDS Updater will be lost.
1. Turning OFF and then ON the main power executes auto recovery. * When this error occurs, the firmware downloaded by the CDS Updater will be lost.
1. Turning OFF and then ON the main power executes auto recovery. * When this error occurs, the firmware downloaded by the CDS Updater will be lost.
File system could not be initialized normally. (CDS-related)
File system could not be initialized normally
1. Turning OFF and then ON the main power executes auto recovery. * When this error occurs, the firmware downloaded by the CDS Updater will be lost.
1. Turning OFF and then ON the main power executes auto recovery. * When this error occurs, the firmware downloaded by the CDS Updater will be lost.
1. Turning OFF and then ON the main power executes auto recovery. * When this error occurs, the firmware downloaded by the CDS Updater will be lost.
Memory required to start PDL cannot be allocated.

1. Select Function.gr > MEAP > MEAP FUNCTION = ON, and turn OFF and then ON the main power. * The setting is switched to the following after reboot. • Initial screen setting: Native • MEAP authentication: Off • USB-Host setting: Native • CDS-related: Off
1. Execute Setup > Initialize Menu to initialize NVRAM.
1. Turn OFF and then ON the power. 2. Replace the Main Controller PCB.
An error, such as failure in memory retrieval at initialization, occurred.
An error, such as failure in memory retrieval at initialization, occurred.
1. Turning OFF and then ON the main power executes auto recovery.
An error occurred when accessing the controller.
An error occurred when accessing the controller.
1. Turning OFF and then ON the main power executes auto recovery.
An error, such as failure in memory retrieval at initialization, occurred.
An error, such as failure in memory retrieval at initialization, occurred.
1. Turn OFF and then ON the power. 2. Replace the Main Controller PCB.
1. Turn OFF and then ON the power. 2. Replace the Main Controller PCB.
Communication error occurred after normal startup.
1. Turn OFF and then ON the power. 2. Replace the Main Controller PCB.
1. Turn OFF and then ON the power. 2. Replace the Main Controller PCB.
1. Turn OFF and then ON the power. 2. Replace the Main Controller PCB.
An invalid MAC address has been detected.
An invalid MAC address has been detected.
1. Check the Mac address. 2. Replace the Main Controller PCB.
1. Turn OFF and then ON the power. 2. Replace the Main Controller PCB.
Mismatch between the model information of the Main Controller PCB and the model information of the host machine.
Bootable of another model was detected.
1. Turn OFF and then ON the power. 2. Reinstall the firmware. 3. Replace the Main Controller PCB.
Mismatch of the model for which the firmware was downloaded is detected.
1. Install the firmware according to the model.
1. Turn OFF and then ON the power. 2. Replace the Main Controller PCB.
Unable to rewrite the FLASH ROM
1. Turn OFF and then ON the power. 2. Replace the Main Controller PCB.
1. Turn OFF and then ON the power. 2. Replace the Main Controller PCB.
An error in connection occurred due to controller software.
Due to firmware error, the possibility of solving the error by replacing the Main Controller PCB is low. 1. Check the downloaded firmware again.
1. Check the connection of the Main Fan. 2. Replace the Main Fan. 3. Replace the DC Controller PCB.
1. Check the connection of the Sub Fan. 2. Replace the Sub Fan. 3. Replace the DC Controller PCB.
Low-voltage power supply failure was detected.
1. Check the connection of the Low Voltage Power Supply PCB or the connector. 2. Replace the Low Voltage Power Supply PCB.
1. Check the connector between the Fixing Assembly and the Fixing Power Supply PCB. 2. Replace the Fixing Assembly. 3. Replace the Fixing Power Supply PCB.
